title: They Are Releasing it All... Sh-t Us About to Hit the Fan!
text:
By economic news
Total:
They Are Releasing it All... Sh-t Us About to Hit the Fan!
Sunday, January 21, 2018 6:05
 
As we’ve all heard, the main headlines of the news revolve around the memo that consists of 4 pages which exposes a part of the corruption that was inflicted by former President Barack Obama.
It seems that finally, Obama is facing some dark times. Many people are starting to turn around against him after the truth about him is starting to get out in the open.
He has inflicted numerous terrible policies that are hardening the work that President Donald Trump is facing. The biggest problem is that we haven’t seen anybody go to jail because of their crimes. Hopefully, their luck will be over soon and people like Obama and Hillary Clinton will face some consequences.
Congressman Matt Gaetz spoke with Sean Hannity and said that he believes that there are several people who are connected to Obama’s corruption and will probably face prison time. For eight years, Obama used the power of his office to  ruin  the lives of the Americans.
Several Republicans are now requesting the FISA  memo  to be revealed to the public.
Both, Steve King and Mark Meadows claimed that they acknowledged the House Intelligence Committee’s report which had information about the abuses of Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act that are connected to the FBI. Also, there are allegations that Trump operated with Russia during his campaign. These allegations can’t be proven because there is no evidence, of course, because it isn’t true. It is just a desperate way to ruin Trump’s reputation.
“What I saw is absolutely shocking. This report needs to be released–now. Americans deserve the truth,” Meadows tweeted.
Steve King wrote: “The sickening reality has set in. I no longer hold out hope there is an innocent explanation for the information the public has seen. I have long said it is worse than Watergate.”
According to Hannity, the memo consisted of messages from FBI agent Peter Strzok. For those who don’t know, he was connected to the investigation surrounding Clinton’s private email server.
